thread.title: What time is Sevilla vs Leicester, what TV channel is it on and what are the latest odds?
thread.title_full: What time is Sevilla vs Leicester, what TV channel is it on and what are the latest odds?

author: Telegraph Sport
title: What time is Sevilla vs Leicester, what TV channel is it on and what are the latest odds?
text:
What is it? I t's the first leg of the Champions League round-of-16 tie between Sevilla and Leicester City.
When is it? It's on Wednesday, 22 February 2017.
What time is kick-off? It all kicks off at the Champions League time of 19:45GMT.
Where's it taking place? At the Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán Stadium in Seville.
Leicester will need Jamie Vardy firing on all cyclinders against Sevilla What TV channel is it on? B T Sport 2 will have all the action from 19:00GMT. Alternatively you can follow our live blog. Bookmark this page and catch all the goals and goings on with us, why not?
What is the team news? Claudio Ranieri has said that record signing Islam Slimani could miss the first leg.
Slimani missed Leicester's FA Cup defeat to Millwall at the weekend with a groin injury and remains an injury doubt.
The £30m recruit has made just two substitute appearances for Leicester since returning from international duty with Algeria at the Africa Cup of Nations last month.
Pick your Leicester team to face Sevilla Pick your Sevilla team to face Leicester What are they saying? S evilla boss Jorge Sampaoli 
"We're not talking about the team that won a league miraculously, you have to live in the now. So last year Leicester won the league but right now they are fighting relegation.
"The present matters the most. Ranieri got so much from the team last year with so little but now he is struggling, the past doesn't matter, even when you have done something as miraculous as he did.
"I think Leicester are not having a good time in the league, they have a lot of doubts when last year they had so much belief. They were brilliant in the league last year and have been great in the Champions League, they qualified very quickly so in a two-legged tie it still poses a lot of risks for us."
Leicester coach Claudio Ranieri 
“Nothing is right in the league and we are clearly underdogs here in Sevilla. We are playing without the pressure of the Premier League, we play light, for this reason I hope we can play our football.
“Tomorrow could be the turning point, if we have a very good game something inside could change. We need one match like this.”
What are the odds? Sevilla to win - 4/11 
Draw - 19/5 
Leicester to win - 8/1 
What's our prediction? Without the pressures of their Premier League struggles weighing on their shoulders, Leicester could snatch a goal on the break but end up losing the first leg 2-1. It would be a crucial away goal, though.
